intro: Elatinella, commonly known as the glassworts, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in saline or alkaline environments, such as coastal areas and salt marshes. They are characterized by their succulent, often fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Elatinella species are often used in horticulture for their ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes.
